intro: Acmella lanceolata, commonly known as the spurge pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with a distinctive lobed shape and is often found in moist, sunny habitats. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant. The plant contains latex, which can be irritating to the skin.
